title: Ticket #6473: Python bindings confuse old and new ClassAds quoting rules
description:
Most of the python bindings don't appear to be aware that the string quoting rules are different between the old and new ClassAds formats, and most Condor APIs that take a ClassAd value as a string expect the old format. Internal to the bindings, they unparse an ExprTree into new ClassAds format and then pass the string to a Condor API that expects the old ClassAds format. That's easy to fix. More troublesome, the differences leak into the bindings API. For some functions, the caller needs to pass a string with new ClassAds formatting, and for other functions, the caller needs to use old ClassAds formatting.

The main difference between the old and new formats is how backslash and newline are escaped within a string value.
